sub_title: Project officer Shelter City Utrecht at Peace Brigades International  // Human Rights // Migration // Research
summary:
My name is Lizzy and I am a professional in the field of International Development. In addition to my professional and educational experience, I am excited to share my extensive volunteer work and love for learning new skills with you.

With international experience in a broad range of institutions, I combine research and management expertise to develop programs and research projects within the fields of migration, gender, and human rights. My academic and work experience in social work, communications, advocacy, and project management enable me to integrate complex issues into meaningful solutions. With a drive for justice, a passion for connecting with people, creativity, language skills, and a capacity to take initiative, I am dedicated to creating space for social change.

Feel free to give me a call or send me a message, and I would be happy to exchange ideas with you!

awards:
[{'title': 'NALACS Thesis Award 2019-2020 - Third place', 'description': 'My master thesis got awarded a third place in the competition for the best master thesis written on Latin America and the Caribbean in 2019-2020.


Young Venezuelan migrant women in Bogotá: Aspirations, opportunities and challenges 

The research explored the aspirations, opportunities and challenges that recently migrated young Venezuelan women in Bogotá are experiencing and how these factors influence their capacity to build a sustainable livelihood.', 'issuer': 'NALACS, the Netherlands Association for Latin American and Caribbean Studies', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}]
